name: Weather Essentials
blurb: Uses geolocation and asynchronous API calls to provide real-time weather data in a visual format.

name: Rent-a-Dog
blurb: Static single-page-application for a fictional dog-rental company. Fully responsive and made in a few hours over a weekend.

name: Youtube Clone
blurb: This SPA uses Youtube's API to retrieve videos that the user searches. While typing for videos this app will continuously make calls; albeit inefficient it shows the user how quickly data is passed between users and servers.

name: Gif Lookup
blurb: This app uses React's speed to display API data gathered from gfycat, a popular gif hosting website. I plan to implement a betterlazy-loader to improve load-times and window-freezing.

name: Dictation Application
blurb: Using Chrome's built in microphone, this app will render your voice onto a notepad on your computer screen. Because audio input has to be translated on a server it was tricky determining when to make API calls.

name: Contra-Yelp
blurb: This app was created after eating a terrible reuben sandwich at a restaurant. After a user inputs their zipcode they'll find a list of restaurants with yelp-ratings below 3/5 stars. This app doesn't undo the anguish its developer experiences whenever a reuben is near.

name: 2017-2019 Portfolio
blurb: This was the second portfolio created by this developer. No bootstrapping was used, which looks pretty obvious! Not enough time was put into the design as this was made in a rush and life got in the way!

name: Rails Blog
blurb: This was the first fullstack application that this developer created. It has undergone many changes and is currently being re-developed to resemble something like twitter. It uses encryption (bcrypt) to store passwords and authentication on login.

name: Reddit Cakeday Extension
blurb: This Chrome extension was designed in order to identify any redditors with account-birthdays (cakedays) by displaying a colorful background behind their username. It uses Python and PRAW, a python API wrapper to easily communicate with reddit's servers.

name: C++ School Work
blurb: A collection of C++ work that I had done prior to taking CS classes. In order to grok c++ I made classes, structs, and solved puzzles.

name: Pong/Space Invaders
blurb: This was by far the most difficult application to get running. I wrote on mirrors and windows all over the apartment to suss out the logic that I needed to implement the physics and hit-detection for this game.
